maml:description.maml:para: Get an edge hostname.

Gets all edge hostnames or returns a specific edge hostname by its ID or a combination of its record name and DNS zone. For an edge hostname of `example.com.edgesuite.net`, the record name would be `example.com` and the DNS zone would be `edgesuite.net`. Additionally, when listing all edge hostnames, you can filter the results by various parameters, including `-DNSZone`, `-Map`, `-SlotNumber`, and others.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Filter by `chinaCdnEnabled` status.
Filter by `comments` value.
Filter by `customTarget` value.
Filter by `dnsZone` value.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Filter by `isEdgeIPBindingEnabled` status.
Filter by `map` value.
Filter by `mapAlias` value.
Filter by domain prefix substring.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Filter by `securityType` value, either `STANDARD-TLS` or `ENHANCED-TLS`.
Filter by `slotNumber` value.
Filter by `ttl` setting, in seconds.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Filter by `dnsZone` value.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Record name of the edge hostname, identified as the portion of the edge hostname before the Akamai domain, e.g. edgesuite.net.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Unique identifier for an edge hostname.

Gets the certificate associated with an enhanced TLS edge hostname by its record name and DNS zone.

Get a change request.
Gets all edge hostname change requests, retrieves a single change by its ID, or lists change requests for a specific edge hostname by record name and DNS zone.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Unique identifier for a change request.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Filter by `dnsZone` value.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Status of change requests to retrieve. The only currently available value is PENDING.

Get localization data.
Gets the collection of application property strings in a specific language. > Note: You can tab through the acceptable values for the `-Language` parameter.

The supported language values are `de_DE` for German, `en_US` for English, `es_ES` for Spanish, `es_LA` for Spanish for Latin America, `fr_FR` for French, `it_IT` for Italian, `ja_JP` for Japanese, `ko_KR` for Korean, `pt_BR` for Brazilian Portuguese, `zh_CN` for Simplified Chinese, and `zh_TW` for Traditional Chinese.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

The supported language values are `de_DE` for German, `en_US` for English, `es_ES` for Spanish, `es_LA` for Spanish for Latin America, `fr_FR` for French, `it_IT` for Italian, `ja_JP` for Japanese, `ko_KR` for Korean, `pt_BR` for Brazilian Portuguese, `zh_CN` for Simplified Chinese, and `zh_TW` for Traditional Chinese.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Get products.
Gets the list of product IDs and their corresponding display names for products this API supports.

Delete an edge hostname.

Deletes a specific edge hostname. You need to have an Admin or Technical role to delete an edge hostname. You can delete any hostname that's not currently assigned to an active Property Manager configuration.
Record name of the edge hostname, identified as the portion of the edge hostname before the Akamai domain, e.g. edgesuite.net.
Filter by `dnsZone` value.
Filter by `comments` value.
Email address that should receive updates on the change request. To specify more than one email address use a single comma-separated set of addresses, or repeat the parameter with each address.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Update an edge hostname.
Updates the `-TTL` or `-IPVersionBehavior` for an existing edge hostname.
Record name of the edge hostname, identified as the portion of the edge hostname before the Akamai domain, e.g. edgesuite.net.
Filter by `dnsZone` value.
Attribute to update. Currently only the 'ttl' or 'ipVersionBehavior' can be edit with this command.
The value of the Attribute to update, e.g. for 'ttl' this value might be 60.
Filter by `comments` value.
Email address that should receive updates on the change request. To specify more than one email address use a single comma-separated set of addresses, or repeat the parameter with each address.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
